com.yantra.api.ycm.search

Interface searchCatalogIndex

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface searchCatalogIndex

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document searchCatalogIndex(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The searchCatalogIndex API is used to search for products in a Catalog Index based on specific search criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • searchCatalogIndex

        org.w3c.dom.Document searchCatalogIndex(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException
        The searchCatalogIndex API is used to search for products in a Catalog Index based on specific search criteria. The search criteria can be based on search Terms, Filters, and Categories.

        Terms are simply text, such as the word "computer", that are used by the API to find relevant items that have descriptions or other attributes matching the term(s). Filters are used to narrow down the list of searchable items. For example, a filter may be applied for a specific Color, to narrow down the list of items to return only Red items. Categories are used in a similar way to Filters to narrow down the search results to only items in a specific category.

        Based on the result of the search against the Catalog Index, the searchCatalogIndex API internally calls the getItemListForOrdering API to obtain real-time information about each item. An organization may create and retain multiple Catalog Indices. However, only the Active Index is used for search purposes.

        The AdditionalCatalogIndexInformation element in the input is used to control the IndexFieldNames that will be shown in the output as additional index information. This element in the input is not used as filter for the search. This element may be used to display Item's attributes and other Item Hang-Off attributes allowed by search configuration and already built into the index, provided they are configured as Store=Y in the config property for that field.

        Due to the format that is used when creating the index, all date fields passed as input should use the YYYYMMDDhhmmss format.

        Using wildcard or special characters at the beginning of a search field value is not supported by Lucene.
        Unlike other types of Lucene queries, Wildcard, Prefix, and Fuzzy queries are not passed through the Analyzer. When StandardAnalyzer is used such queries will not be Analyzed for term values.
        Number of Assigned Values Returned

        The number of assigned values returned in the output is determined by the NUMBER_OF_ATTR_FOR_SEARCH rule. By default, only the first 8 assigned values are returned in the output. If all the assigned values are desired in the output, you must specify each attribute you want to consider in the input by passing the ShowAllAssignedValues element.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

      User Exits:

        Please refer to the user exits of the getItemListForOrdering API.


      Events Raised:
      None.

      Audits:
      None.

      Pre Conditions:
      None.

      Post Conditions:
      None.

      Output Template Support:
      Yes.

      Database Extensibility Support:
      Yes.

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
XML document. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
